text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: Today I have a very special guest, it’s
Megan! Megan: Hello!

Ro: She’s an awesome singer and has a cool YouTube
channel, I’m gonna put a link down

Ro: below for you guys to go check it out
if you want. And Megan,

Ro: do you like penguins? Megan: Um, I love
penguins!

Ro: Yes! I had to invite her over to make
something Holiday themed, and,

Ro: Penguins just seemed to fit in for the
holidays. Megan: Yes! I love them!

Ro: So today we are gonna be making Awkward
Penguin Cookies!

Ro: And this is how we get it going in the
Nerdy Nummies kitchen.
Both: Let’s get started!
Ro: I don’t know when to stop.

Ro: We are gonna be making a vanilla almond
sugar cookie recipe, from my cookbook.

Ro: So, the things you will need, will be:
3 cups of flour, 3/4 cup almond meal,

Ro: 1-1/2 cup of sugar, and down here, just
1 little tablespoon of sugar, I’ve

Ro: kept them separate because you will add
this at a different time.

Ro: 1-1/2 teaspoons of vanilla extract, 1/2
teaspoon of grated nutmeg,

Ro: 1/8 teaspoon of salt, 1 teaspoon of baking
powder, 1/2 a teaspoon of almond
Ro: extract, you will also need…

Megan: 2 eggs, 2 sticks of butter, black food
coloring, black royal icing,

Megan: white royal icing and orange royal
icing.
Both: Now let’s put it all together!
Both: Let it snow, let it snow, let it snow!

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do,
in a medium sized bowl, we’re gonna

Ro: whisk together our dry ingredients, we
are gonna add our flour, nutmeg,

Ro: our smaller measurement of sugar. Megan:
Almond flour, salt and baking powder!
Megan: Mix it up!
Both: Mix it up, mix it up!

Ro: This is all mixed up and now we’re gonna
set it off to the side and we're gonna
Ro: mix together our wet ingredients.

Megan: For the wet ingredients, we’re going
to mix together the 2 sticks of

Megan: butter. Ro: That’s right! These are
room temperature, they’re really soft,

Ro: a little squishy! And you’re just gonna
put him in the bowl.
Megan: Almost there, there!

Ro: And you’re just gonna mix them together
until they’re fluffy!

Ro: Do you want to see what happens if you
put it on 10?
Megan: Oh!
Ro: Isn’t that crazy?

Megan: Now we are going to mix in the sugar
with the butter,
Megan: until it’s nice and fluffy!

Ro: Now we’re gonna add our eggs, one at
a time, mixing in between each 1.
Ro: Do you want to try the 1 handed egg crack?

Ro: So what I like to do is crack it on the
side of the bowl, and then give
Ro: it a twist. Both: Crack and a twist!

Megan: Yay! Ro: Yes! What!?! Professional!
Professional! Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes!
Ro: Then mix it up one more time.

Megan: Next thing we are going to add is our
extracts, the vanilla and almond.

Ro: So now we’ve got our wet ingredients
and our dry ingredients, and what

Ro: we’re gonna do is we’re gonna add
1/2 of our dry ingredients to the wet,

Ro: mix it up, and then Megan, is gonna scrape
down the sides.

Ro: And then we’re gonna add the other 1/2
of our dry, mix it up and
Ro: again, Megan will scrape down the sides.

Megan: Now that our dough is done we are going
to split 1/2 of it into the
Megan: mixing bowl, and dye it black.

Ro: We just eyeballed it, and then I’m gonna
put a few drops of black food

Ro: coloring into the bowl, and mix it together
until the dough is a black color.

Ro: Now both of our doughs are ready and we are
going to put them on this piece

Ro: of saran wrap, and I’m just gonna pack
it down to be about an inch tall.
Ro: And then wrap it up tight!

Ro: We got both of our doughs wrapped up and
now we are gonna pop these
Ro: into the fridge for about an hour to chill.

Megan: We let it chill, now we are going to
roll it into a log shape.

Ro: Mmhmm! We’re gonna be rolling it into
a log that is about 18 inches long
Ro: and, an inch and a half thick.

Ro: And this will be the little belly of the
penguin. Megan: Ahhh.
Ro: His little belly!
Megan: Rolling dough! Ro: Doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!
Megan: Here we dough! Ro: Here we dough!

Ro: Now that we’ve rolled out our dough
to be about 18 inches long we are going

Ro: to wrap it in saran wrap and pop it into
the freezer and let it chill until
Ro: it’s completely frozen.
Ro: OK, Ohp! Sorry, oh girl, OK

Megan: Now that our dough log is frozen, we
rolled out the black dough.

Ro: Mmmhmmm, our black dough was chilling
in the fridge and we rolled it out to

Ro: be about the same length as our dough
log. And it’s about 1/4 inch thick.
Ro: And, what we’re also gonna do is take the rolling pin, Megan I’m gonna show you a little trick.

Megan: OK. Ro: To make these look like penguins.
Right in the middle we’re gonna
Ro: make a little groove, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!

Ro: And, now we’re gonna use some egg wash
which is 1 egg, mixed up with a little

Ro: bit of water, and I got a little brush
here.

Megan: I’m ready! Ro: And you’re just
gonna brush down the middle, of this
Ro: little indent that we made.
Ro: Oh my gosh, this is huge, OK here we go.

Ro: You’re just gonna place it right down
the middle and then…

Megan: It’s gonna make a lot of penguins.
Ro: If you’ll help me, uh push,

Ro: just put a little pressure. Just
so it will stick on there.

Ro: And now, you’re gonna grab your egg
wash one more time, and Megan,

Ro: I’m gonna have you wash the whole top
of the dough log.

Ro: So now, we’re gonna take the end of
the parchment paper, and we’re gonna
Ro: roll it on top of the dough.

Ro: Now we’re gonna do it on the other side,
and we’re gonna do a little bit

Ro: of egg wash right in between, just so the dough
will stick to the dough.

Megan: We’re getting 1 step closer to a
little penguin!
Ro: Oh my gosh, we’re so close!

Ro: Slowly peel it off! Megan: Ooooh! Ro:
There we go, that’s what we want.

Ro: You’ll want the top of the log to have
double the amount of black cookie dough.

Ro: We’re gonna wrap it up one more time,
pop it in the freezer until it’s
Ro: completely frozen.

Ro: Our dough log has completely frozen, and,
I just cut off the end, I wanted

Ro: to show you guys what it will look like.
Look! It’s the outline,

Ro: our little penguin body, I’m so excited!
Megan: Yay!

Ro: This is why we double layered the black
cookie dough so that it would have

Ro: a little bit more space on the top, where
we are gonna decorate the little

Ro: Penguin’s face. Megan: His face! Ro:
His little face!

Ro: So now what we’re gonna do is we’re
gonna cut slices using a sharp cutting

Ro: knife, so be careful, and we’re gonna
cut them about 1/4 inch thick.

Ro: And place them onto a baking sheet lined
with a piece of parchment paper.

Megan: Now that we have our tray of Penguins
ready, we are going to put it in
Megan: the oven at 350 degrees for 7-9 minutes.

Ro: Mmmhmm, and I’m gonna keep cutting cookie
slices over here.

Megan: … Which way is the oven? Ro: It’s
that way, it’s that way. Megan: It’s this way?

Megan: Now that our cookies have baked, it’s
time to put them on a plate

Megan: to decorate. Ro: This is my favorite
part, and, I brought the book out so

Ro: that you can get a good idea of how we’re
gonna decorate them.

Ro: We’re just gonna use 3 different icing
colors, the white, orange and black.
Ro: To make all of their little features.

Ro: We’ve got white royal icing in a plastic
baggie with a number 2 tip
Ro: for a little bit more control.

Ro: You just put a little pressure, I do a
little dot where I want the eyes to be.

Ro: Slowly squeeze and go up and down to fill
‘em in.

Megan: Now we are going to take the orange
icing to make his beak and his little feet.

Ro: So what I like to do is just make a triangle,
right on the top of his little

Ro: white belly, I don’t actually know how
many toes a penguin has but,
Ro: my version, they have 3.

Ro: Last but not least you’re gonna take
your black royal icing with a number 1

Ro: tip at the end, and we’re gonna ice
on 2 little loops, they’re like

Ro: sideways ‘U’s’ for wings and eyeballs,
to decorate.
Ro: This is really cute!

Ro: You can give them a little bit of personality
with their eyes, you can

Ro: make them cross-eyed, or looking up, you
can do whatever.
Ro: Here we dough, here we dough!
Both: Here we dough, here we dough!
Megan: Outtro to the video! Ro: Ohhhhh!
Ro: I love it!
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are the Awkward Penguin Sugar Cookies
that we made today, from my cookbook!

Ro: And, a big thank you to Megan for helping
me bake today!

Megan: Awe, thanks for having me! Ro: She
is amazing! She's super awesome, and,

Ro: I’m gonna be putting all her links down
below, so again, you should go

Ro: check her out. I’m also gonna be posting
lots of pictures of these little

Ro: cookies on Instagram, Facebook, Tumblr
and Twitter.

Ro: And, if you guys make these, please take
a picture and send it to me,
Ro: send it to us! Megan: Yes!

Ro: You can tweet it to us. Megan: I love
penguins!

Ro: We would love to see your baking creations,
it would make my day!

Ro: Just makes me happy! And, if you have
any other ideas for any other

Ro: Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave
me a comment down below and I
Ro: will do my best to make it happen.

Ro: Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Megan: Bye!

Megan: Do we finally get to eat one of these?
Ro: Oh yeah!

Ro: We gotta do Awkward Penguin cheers. Megan:
Yes.
Both: Cheers!
Ro: Then we’re gonna chomp off his face.
Ro: Mmmmmm! Megan: Mmm!

Megan: I’m gonna take a couple of these
with me if that’s OK.

Ro: That’s OK. Megan: And by a couple I
mean like 6…
Ro: Wait a minute… Megan: Sure!

Ro: I’m not sure on the math on this,
but there’s only 6 here….
